Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made with fruit from Les Collines Vineyard, this breathtaking Syrah is balanced, with elevated acidity, plush tannins and restrained alcohol. Aromas and flavors of blackberries, saline, hibiscus flowers, black pepper and an almond croissant dazzle. Easily one of the best wines I tasted in 2022.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Gramercy 2019 John Lewis Reserve Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))Editors' Choice

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Few things are more distinctive than a zesty style of Syrah, as evidenced in this blend of the Nelson and Gali vineyards. Brisk, snappy and fresh aromas of smashed acai and blackberry lead into a texturally complex palate of refreshing, tart fruit, boosted by ample pepper and herb notes.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Samuel Louis Smith 2021 Sandstone Terrace Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This cool-climate wine tastes like it came the northern Rhone Valley, offering earthy, peppery overtones and deep, concentrated black currants and blackberries. Its moderate tannins are well-matched by a rich texture that extends the fruit into a lingering finish. Best through 2030.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Marimar 2018 Don Miguel Vineyard Estate Grown Syrah (Russian River Valley)Cellar Selection

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lush aromas of purple flowers and freshly smashed plums are fresh while rich on the nose of this bottling, which is layered in mace and cinnamon spices. Gingerbread and star anise flavors surrounded the baked plum and berry elements of the rich palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Claiborne & Churchill 2020 Spanish Springs Vineyard Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh aromas of red currant, red apple and light bay leaf show on the nose of this immediately likable and still young bottling. The palate is zippy in acidity and loaded with lively flavors of raspberry and white pepper.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Luna Hart 2021 Hinnrichs Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intense aromas of black plum and fresh flowers meet with tar and iodine on the nuanced nose of this bottling. The palate balances purple fruit and flowers flavors with the more rugged dried kelp and asphalt elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Piazza Family 2020 Estate Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
